comments: Tests applicable to table functions in general - we use EXPLODE here but we could use any table table function

tests.name: table function as last select
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, ID, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) VAL FROM TEST;

tests.name: table function as first select
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) AS VAL, ID FROM TEST;

tests.name: table function with non selected columns
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, FOO BIGINT, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>, BAR BIGINT) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) AS VAL, ID FROM TEST;

tests.name: table function with no other selected columns
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, FOO BIGINT, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>, BAR BIGINT) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) AS VAL FROM TEST;

tests.name: table function with no alias
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, FOO BIGINT, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>, BAR BIGINT) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) FROM TEST;

tests.name: table function shouldn't be in FROM clause
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT * FROM EXPLODE(MY_ARR);

tests.name: multiple table functions
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID STRING KEY, MY_ARR1 ARRAY<BIGINT>, MY_ARR2 ARRAY<BIGINT>, BAR BIGINT) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, EXPLODE(MY_ARR1), EXPLODE(MY_ARR2) FROM TEST;

tests.name: table functions with complex expressions
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, F0 INT, F1 INT, F2 INT, F3 INT) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, F0, EXPLODE(ARRAY[ABS(F1 + F2), ABS(F2 + F3), ABS(F3 + F1)]) FROM TEST;

tests.name: test_udtf - simple params
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, F0 INT, F1 BIGINT, F2 DOUBLE, F3 BOOLEAN, F4 STRING, F5 DECIMAL(20, 10), F6 STRUCT<A VARCHAR>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, TEST_UDTF(F0, F1, F2, F3, F4, F5, F6) FROM TEST;

tests.name: test_udtf - key column
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID INT KEY, NAME STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, TEST_UDTF(ID) FROM TEST;

tests.name: test_udtf - array params
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID STRING KEY, F0 ARRAY<INT>, F1 ARRAY<BIGINT>, F2 ARRAY<DOUBLE>, F3 ARRAY<BOOLEAN>, F4 ARRAY<STRING>, F5 ARRAY<DECIMAL(20, 10)>, F6 ARRAY<STRUCT<A VARCHAR>>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, TEST_UDTF(F0, F1, F2, F3, F4, F5, F6) FROM TEST;

tests.name: test_udtf - map params
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID STRING KEY, F0 MAP<STRING, INT>, F1 MAP<STRING, BIGINT>, F2 MAP<STRING, DOUBLE>, F3 MAP<STRING, BOOLEAN>, F4 MAP<STRING, STRING>, F5 MAP<STRING, DECIMAL(20, 10)>, F6 MAP<STRING, STRUCT<A VARCHAR>>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, TEST_UDTF(F0, F1, F2, F3, F4, F5, F6) FROM TEST;

tests.name: test_udtf - return vals
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, F0 INT, F1 BIGINT, F2 DOUBLE, F3 BOOLEAN, F4 STRING, F5 DECIMAL(20, 10), F6 STRUCT<A VARCHAR>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, TEST_UDTF(F0), TEST_UDTF(F1), TEST_UDTF(F2), TEST_UDTF(F3), TEST_UDTF(F4), TEST_UDTF(F5), TEST_UDTF(F6) FROM TEST;

sources.name: OUTPUT
sources.schema: K STRING KEY, KSQL_COL_0 INT, KSQL_COL_1 BIGINT, KSQL_COL_2 DOUBLE, KSQL_COL_3 BOOLEAN, KSQL_COL_4 STRING, KSQL_COL_5 DECIMAL(30, 10), KSQL_COL_6 STRUCT<A VARCHAR>

tests.name: table function with where clause
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, F0 INT, F1 ARRAY<INT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, F0, EXPLODE(F1) VAL FROM TEST WHERE F0 <> 1;

tests.name: table functions don't support table sources
statements: CREATE TABLE TEST (K STRING PRIMARY KEY, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT K, ID, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) VAL FROM TEST;

expectedException.message: Table source is not supported with table functions

tests.name: with select *
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID STRING KEY, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT *, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) VAL FROM TEST;

tests.name: with duplicate columns
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, ID, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) VAL, ID AS ID2 FROM TEST;

tests.name: with duplicate udtfs
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, EXPLODE(MY_ARR), EXPLODE(MY_ARR) FROM TEST;

tests.name: should handle UDTFs that throw
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, shouldThrow BOOLEAN) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, shouldThrow, throwing_udtf(shouldThrow) FROM TEST;

tests.name: should handle UDTF parameter evaluation that throws
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (K STRING KEY, shouldThrow BOOLEAN) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT K, shouldThrow, test_udtf(bad_udf(shouldThrow)) FROM TEST;

tests.name: stream without key
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID BIGINT, MY_ARR ARRAY<BIGINT>) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, EXPLODE(MY_ARR) VAL, ID AS ID2 FROM TEST;
